label: Description
value: Vertical view of a woman seated at a square piano and playing from an open book of music.

label: Description
value: Horizontal view of a clapboard shack with an arbor over the doorway and a smaller shack visible behind, to the right.

label: Description
value: Horizontal view of a mustached man dressed in hiking attire reclining on his left elbow on a flat ledge of rock and holding in his right hand a turned-over pipe, as a walking stick leans across him from right to left, with the prospect of wide river valley in distance behind him.

label: Physical description
value: Black and white crayon on brown laid paper, blackened on verso for transfer

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.

label: Notes
value: Horizontal view of a mustached man dressed in hiking attire reclining on his left elbow on a flat ledge of rock and holding in his right hand a turned-over pipe, as a walking stick leans across him from right to left, with the prospect of wide river valley in distance behind him.

label: Description
value:
Recto: A soldier in Civil War uniform, stands in the foreground, feet spread, holding a rifle placed diagonally across his body in his left hand, using a long rod in his right hand to tamp gun powder down the barrel of the rifle. 

Verso:  A head is shown from the back, at center; a wounded soldier sits leaning on both hands, shown in full length and in the opposite direction, at top; and a dead soldier lies with bent knees and covers his face with his left hand, at bottom.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk and white crayon on gray-green laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.

label: Notes
value: Recto: A soldier in Civil War uniform, stands in the foreground, feet spread, holding a rifle placed diagonally across his body in his left hand, using a long rod in his right hand to tamp gun powder down the barrel of the rifle.

label: Description
value: Pear-shaped body; scrolled strap handle, bracketed lip; domed cover with knob of flower in relief.  Body yellow, with two shaped panels, outlined in brown, of white reserve with bouquets of flowers; smaller panels on cover.  Handle and lip white, with touches of pink on modelled decoration of shells and imbrication.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Edward Luckemeyer; 1912: acquired by the Museum

label: Description
value: Cup with simple loop handle; saucer deep, with curved sides.  Inside of cup and saucer white, with scattered flowers; outside of cup and underside of rim of saucer yellow, with white reserve panels, on cup, in which are flowers.  Edges of cup and saucer brown.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Edward Luckemeyer; 1912: acquired by the Museum

label: Description
value: Narrow fragment of red satin embroidered in green, blue, white, yellow, and brown silk and gold metallic thread. Right and left borders in blue silk. Central motif of quatrefoil enclosed by circle of gold with fleur-de-lys and acanthus foliage.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidered on satin weave

label: Description
value: Fragment of white satin brocaded in gold metallic thread, pink and terra-cotta silks and blue chenille has a large-scale scrolling leaves and small floral sprays.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic yarns Technique: satin weave with supplementary weft patterning (brocade), chenille

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1912: Mrs. Edward Luckemeyer collection; 1912: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Globus; scrolled strap handle; spout terminating in dog's head; cover with flower in high relief.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Edward Luckemeyer; 1912: acquired by the Museum

label: Description
value: White horizontally ribbed plain weave with a large-scale embroidered design in multicolored silks and heavy metallic thread. Symmetrical arrangement of large-scale ornamental shellts, rococo scrolls, vases, flowers, and foliage. Edged with woven metallic trim.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Fragment with a design of large flowers, leaves and stems embroidered in shades of red, purple, blue, and green with metallic thread on a ground of cream-colored silk woven in a horizontal chevron pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value: a) front and b) back of chasuble. Central vertical panel in each of straight stem with blossoms, foliage and ribbons. Side panels of serpentine branch with large curling leaves, blossoms and perching birds. Brilliant polychrome silks and gold metal thread, all in laid stitches. Background of silk laid work.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metal thread on linen; lined with linen Technique: laid stitch embroidery on plain weave

label: Description
value: Component a: large roughly rectangular panel composed of a number of small fragments - on right a double border - rest of piece divided, by gold galloon, into rectangles, each rectangle enclosing a symmetrical arrangement of straight stems with foliage and various types of blossoms - birds perch here and there on the stems and branches - in two bottom rectangles a shield with pale blue field has crest of skull and cross bones - the double border on right is formed of motifs similar to those in rectangles but running at right angles to body of piece - on left two long triangular shaped pieces have been sewed to the edge - upper center looks like the back of a chasuble - upper right the border continues well beyond body of piece.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silks and gold metal thread on linen foundation Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value: Yellow silk grosgrain brocaded with multicolored silks. Design has serpentine ribbons covered with pink cloverleaves and yellow scalloped edges. Between ribbons are symmetrical floral sprays and delicate branches with pink, blue and purple buds.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain weave (yellow) patterned by floats of a continuous supplementary weft (yellow) and discontinuous supplementary wefts (multicolor)

label: Description
value: Woven textile fragments in symmetrical large-scale design of central palmette flanked by columns encircled by acanthus leaves, flowers, foliage, and bunches of grapes brocaded in multicolored silks and silver metallic thread.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, cotton, metallic yarns Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1912: Mrs. Edward Luckemeyer collection; 1912: acquired by the Museum

label: Description
value: Narrow portion of tapestry with brown ground and incomplete small-scale floral design in greens, white, rose and blue.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool and silk wefts on wool warps Technique: tapestry weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 29.2 x 97.5 cm (11 1/2 x 38 3/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Rectangular, with rounded shoulders and collar about circular opening. Silver stopper-cap.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Edward Luckemeyer; 1912: acquired by the Museum

label: Description
value: Fragments of vertically-striped pink and white taffeta. White stripes have narrow pink and green guard borders with pink and green birds, flowers, sprigs, and tassels. White stripes have moire effect.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain compound weave with supplementary weft

label: Description
value: Altar frontal of red silk grosgrain embroidered in multicolored silks, gold and silver thread and sequins. Central motif of the dove with an allover design of flowers, fruit, and grain. Edged with gold lace and lined with red taffeta.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread, metal sequins Technique: silk embroidery on silk foundation

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain compound cloth brocaded with trimming

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain compound cloth brocaded with trimming

label: Description
value: Seven fragments of textile panel, originally made up of three widths of material, edged with narrow strip of brocade with blue ground and backed with blue silk.  White satin ground with gold, red, yellow and white brocade. Irregular-shaped vessels from which flowers emerge.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic Technique: satin brocaded with silks and metal

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft (a): 68.6 × 54 cm (27 in. × 21 1/4 in.) Warp x Weft (b): 68.6 × 54 cm (27 in. × 21 1/4 in.) Warp x Weft (c): 68.6 × 54 cm (27 in. × 21 1/4 in.)

label: Description
value: Vertical design of leaves and abstract in red, green, blue and beige. Piece probably salvaged from a bed curtain.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in cross and Rhodian cross stitches on plain weave

value: Trimming fragment of narrow panel of white satin ground with central yellow satin stripe.  Over this is velvet in geometric zigzag in pink and black.
